lines.text: Jeonard
Tahn
BUPLC RELSTION COUNTE.
andAssociates.Inc.
P O BOX 523 • 13 LINCOLN ROAD • GREAY NECK, NY 11021 + (212I 89S7445
March 24, 1980
Dr. Carl C. Seltzer
39 Williston Road
Brookline, Massachusetts O2146
Dear Carl:
Enclosed is a new draft_of a release on your
forthcoming AHJ editorial. It was prepared after
discussion with the Shook, Hardy & Bacon people
in Kansas City.
You'll notice that the changes are really few
and minimal. There's a new headline and a full
quote for the opening paragraph. Also, there's a
new second-from-the-end paragraph that I think is
quite good. I somehow missed it earlier.
I would suggest one other thing: when the re-
lease is issued it would be helpful to put the
journal's publication date, e.g. May issue, in
parentheses at the end of the first paragraph.
If your reaction to the re-draft is differ-
ent than that to the first version, please let
me know.
Hilda and I enjoyed seeing you and Ruth in
San Diego and we look forward to seeing you at
the Twin Congress in Jerusa.lem in June. We will
be staying at the Plaza Hotel there.
Incidentally, I've arranged for Prof. Parisi
to invite Joann Rodgers of the Hearst papers to
attend the Congress.
With best wishes.
Sincerely,
Leonard S. Zahn
LSZ:hg
Encl.
CC: Bernard O'Neill, :.

Dear Carl:
Enclosed is a new draft_of a release on your
forthcoming AHJ editorial. It was prepared after
discussion with the Shook, Hardy & Bacon people
in Kansas City.
You'll notice that the changes are really few

new second-from-the-end paragraph that I think is
quite good. I somehow missed it earlier.
I would suggest one other thing: when the re-
lease is issued it would be helpful to put the
journal's publication date, e.g. May issue, in
parentheses at the end of the first paragraph.
If your reaction to the re-draft is differ-
ent than that to the first version, please let
me know.
Hilda and I enjoyed seeing you and Ruth in

Incidentally, I've arranged for Prof. Parisi
